intro: Boehmeria castaneifolia, commonly known as the Chinese nettle or nettle tree, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the family Urticaceae and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves with a rough, hairy texture. The plant produces small, greenish flowers that are clustered in panicles, and it is often found in moist, shaded environments. Its fibrous stems have been used in traditional crafts and as a source of natural fibers. The plant is also valued for its medicinal properties in some cultures.
